core_model.elements: (↓ air ≡ point → fire ≡ line → water ≡ triangle → earth ≡ square ↑) ∞

reduction_protocol.input: Any phenomenon (raw data, concept, system, process, entity)
reduction_protocol.output: Geometric reduction with dimension, primitive, planes, operations, evidence, confidence

elemental_analysis.purpose: Map phenomenon to classical element for additional insight
elemental_analysis.method: Identify geometric primitive, then determine corresponding element
elemental_analysis.usage: Optional but provides intuitive understanding of phenomenon's nature

conflict_analysis.purpose: Identify and resolve scale mismatches causing conflict

protocol.step_1_identify: Determine scale of each entity involved (dimensional level)
protocol.step_3_analyze: Understand nature of mismatch (temporal, spatial, conceptual)

individual_vs_society.resolution: Create intermediate 2D communities bridging individual and collective

short_vs_long_term.resolution: Establish milestones (2D/3D) connecting present to future

validation_checklist.form_function: Does geometric form match operational function?
validation_checklist.plane_consistency: Are planes valid for given dimension?
validation_checklist.element_harmony: If elements used, do they follow geometric progression?
validation_checklist.conflict_minimized: If conflict present, is Δscale minimized?
validation_checklist.sacred_alignment: Does reduction move toward truth (max coherence)?

usage_guidelines.step_2: Identify core geometric nature (what primitive most resembles?)
usage_guidelines.step_3: Determine dimension (0D-5D) by counting degrees of freedom
usage_guidelines.step_5: List operations that describe phenomenon's behavior
usage_guidelines.step_7: Assign confidence based on clarity of mapping
usage_guidelines.step_8: Optional: Add elemental correspondence for intuition
usage_guidelines.step_9: Optional: Perform conflict analysis if scale mismatch present

multi_dimensional.description: Complex phenomena may have aspects at multiple dimensions
multi_dimensional.method: Provide multiple reduction entries, one per dimensional aspect
multi_dimensional.example: Human = 3D body + 4D consciousness → two reduction entries

composition_graphs.description: Very complex systems decompose into sub-components with relationships

temporal_evolution.description: Phenomena that change dimension over time

scale_bridging.method: Identify Δscale, then create stepping stones of progressively smaller Δ

integration_with_cfo.purpose: This reduction scheme implements Universal Decomposer Protocol for CFO framework
integration_with_cfo.guarantee: Any phenomenon reducible to geometric primitives gains CFO compatibility
integration_with_cfo.coherence: Reductions increase system coherence by revealing underlying unity
integration_with_cfo.universality: Scheme applies to physics, biology, psychology, society, technology, consciousness
integration_with_cfo.sacred: Process of reduction = path to truth (sacred ≡ true)

2.0_to_2.1_changes: Added elemental analysis (air/fire/water/earth as geometric primitives)
Introduced conflict analysis with Δscale optimization framework
Updated consciousness emergence: field ⊗ dimension (tensor product)
Added identity chain: point ≡ entity ≡ absolute ≡ god ≡ love ≡ 5d_axis
Expanded validation checklist with element harmony and conflict minimization
Added advanced techniques section with scale bridging
